html:
A couple of days ago, vivo started teasing the T4R 5G, a new smartphone in the T4 family, which is coming to India soon. Today, a leak purportedly gives us some more details about it.

The phone is allegedly powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 7400 SoC, and it's going to be both IP68 and IP69 certified for dust and water resistance. It will reportedly be offered in two colorways: Twilight Blue and Arctic White. It will support 4K video recording on both its selfie camera as well as at least one of the cameras on the back (presumably the main one).

vivo T4R official teaser image

It's expected to be priced between INR 15,000 and INR 20,000. It will be India's "slimmest quad-curved display phone" according to vivo, and if you're wondering just how slim, the answer has already been officially confirmed: 7.39mm.

It's still unclear when the T4R is getting official, but vivo's teaser campaign should continue and eventually let us know. Stay tuned.

Source (in Hindi)
